Making his debut as the lead singer with the Screaming Trees in 1985, Mark Lanegan has gone on to establish himself as one of the most powerful and distinctive voices in American music.
LaneganÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s deep, nicotine-burnished voice is an ideal complement for the often dark themes of his lyrics, which are thoughtful and literate without being pretentious, and heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s collaborated with a stellar roster of musicians, including Kurt Cobain, Greg Dulli, Josh Homme, Isobel Campbell, and Moby.
Since making his solo debut with 1990's The Winding Sheet, Lanegan has created a striking body of work that embraces blues, country, folk, rock, and many spaces in between. Has God Seen My Shadow?
